intro: Gamwellia flava subsp. mitwabaensis, commonly known as the Mitwaba gamwell, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky and well-drained soils, often in mountainous or forested areas. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct ecological and morphological traits compared to other members of the Gamwellia genus. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
